fileheader.filedesc: Functions that interact with and alter UO game world data, including server-client messages.
fileheader.constant: const CRMULTI_IGNORE_WORLDZ := 0x0004; // ignore standability, relative Z, world height
const LH_FLAG_LOS := 1; // only include those in LOS
const FP_IGNORE_DOORS := 0x02; // ignore Doors (you've to open doors by yourself)
const VENDOR_SEND_AOS_TOOLTIP := 0x01; // send Item Description using AoS Tooltips
const VENDOR_BUYABLE_CONTAINER_FILTER := 0x02; // filter items in the SendSellWindow() by what is in the buyable container
const LISTENPT_HEAR_GHOSTS := 0x01; // hear ghost speech in addition to living speech
const LISTENPT_HEAR_TOKENS := 0x02; // hear also speechtokens (only with ssopt.SeperateSpeechTokens)
const LISTENPT_NO_SPEECH := 0x04; // hear no normal speech (only with ssopt.SeperateSpeechTokens)
const ITEMS_IGNORE_STATICS := 0x01; // Don't list Static Items
const ITEMS_IGNORE_MULTIS := 0x02; // Don't list Multi Items
const LIST_IGNORE_Z := 0x40000000; // Ignore Z-Value and list everything
// ListItemsNearLocationWithFlag( x,y,z, range, flags ); tiledata flags
const TILEDATA_FLAG_INTERNAL := 0x00010000; //Internal (things like hair, beards, etc)
// GetStandingLayers( x, y, flags, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM ); mapdata flags
const MAPDATA_FLAG_WALKBLOCK := 0x0057; // Move Land, Move Sea, Blocking, Block Sight, Allow DropOn
const MAPDATA_FLAG_MOVE_FLAGS := 0x0063; // Move Land, Move Sea, Blocking, Gradual
const MOVEOBJECT_NORMAL := 0x0; // Implicit. Will move if able.
const MOVEITEM_IGNOREMOVABLE := 0x20000000; // Will ignore the movable property on items.
const JOURNAL_PRINT_NAME := 0x00; // Implicit. Print's the object's description / npc's name in the journal.
const JOURNAL_PRINT_YOU_SEE := 0x01; // Will print "You see:" in the journal.
const MOVETYPE_PLAYER := 0; // Moved by the player
const MOVETYPE_COREMOVE := 1; // Moved with MoveItem*() (or equiv)
const MOVETYPE_CORECREATE := 2; // Created with CreateItemIn*() (or equiv)
const ENUMERATE_IGNORE_LOCKED := 0x1; // List content of locked container.
const ENUMERATE_ROOT_ONLY := 0x2; // Do not list contents of sub-containers.
const FINDSUBSTANCE_IGNORE_LOCKED := 0x1; // Find matches in locked containers
const FINDSUBSTANCE_ROOT_ONLY := 0x2; // Do not find matches in sub-containers.
const FINDSUBSTANCE_FIND_ALL := 0x4; // Find all matches ignoring given amount
const FINDOBJTYPE_IGNORE_LOCKED := 0x1; // Find matches in locked containers.
const FINDOBJTYPE_ROOT_ONLY := 0x2; // Do not find matches in sub-containers.
// Target Options - add these together and pass as second
// Don't use these outside this file, use FONT_* from client.inc
// (and I don't know what for color)
const ACCESSIBLE_DEFAULT := -1; // uses the default from ssopt
const ACCESSIBLE_IGNOREDISTANCE := -2; // ignores the range check

function.name: AddAmount
function.explain: Adds the specified amount to a stack of items. Amount is between 1 and 60000
function.return: ItemRef on success or error on failure
function.error: "That item is being used" (if inuse or reserved)
"Can't add that much to that stack" (if resulting amount > 60000)

function.name: ConsumeReagents
function.explain: Removes reagent items from caster's pack according to spellid's definition in spells.cfg. Spells.cfg files define spells & spell ids.
function.return: 1 on successful consume, 0 if not enough of defined reagents
function.error: "Spell ID out of range" if !(spellid >= 1 && spellid <= last spellid)
"No such spell" if spellid not found

function.name: ConsumeSubstance

parameter.name: objtype
parameter.value: Integer objtype to find and consume

function.explain: Subtracts "amount" of type "objtype", starting in container "container"
function.error: "That is not a container" if container.isa(POLCLASS_CONTAINER) == false
"Not enough of that substance in container"

function.name: CreateItemInInventory

parameter.name: objtype
parameter.value: Integer objtype for item to be created, OR String ObjtypeName, OR GetItemDescriptor struct.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.value: size of stack to be created. Default = 1

function.explain: Creates a stack of items in the specified container. As usual, objtype must be valid and amount must be 1..60000. FORCES STACKING: If the specified obytpe is not stackable by default (i.e. most weapons), this function WILL CREATE A STACK! This will cause a client crash if container is a player's pack! Therefore, this function SHOULD ONLY BE USED WITH NPC MERCHANTS' STORAGE AREA INVENTORIES! For normal containers, use CreateItemInContainer().
Note: Will call the container's canInsert and onInsert scripts.
function.error: "That is not a container" if container.isa(POLCLASS_CONTAINER) == false
"That container is full" if weight would be > 65535, or if would exceed maximum # of items
"Could not insert item into container." if canInsert script returns false

function.name: FindObjtypeInContainer
function.explain: Returns an Item Reference to the first found item matching objtype starting in "container".

uo.em constants for flags:
// FindObjtype constants const FINDOBJTYPE_RECURSIVE := 0x0; // Search in sub-containers (DEFAULT). const FINDOBJTYPE_IGNORE_LOCKED := 0x1; // Find matches in locked containers const FINDOBJTYPE_ROOT_ONLY := 0x2; // Do not find matches in sub-containers.
function.error: "That is not a container" if container.isa(POLCLASS_CONTAINER) == false

function.name: GetEquipmentByLayer
function.explain: Gets an item reference to an equipped item. For proper layer values, see scripts/include/client.inc

function.name: GetObjPropertyNames
function.explain: Gets all the CProp names set on the object. Use GetObjProperty(object, returned_array[i]) to get the CProp value.

function.name: GetObjTypeByName
function.explain: Finds the matching Object Type number for the obejct named "name" Matches on the itemdesc.cfg property "Name".

function.name: GetObjType
function.explain: Returns the Objtype of an object. Same as ref.objtype. Works for item root classed and character root classed.

function.name: ListItemsAtLocation

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Returns a list of items at the specified x,y,z. test ret != 0
Use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value.
function.return: <uninitialized object> if invalid parameters, or Array of Item References of items at that location.

Notes: This function will not generate "Invalid Coordinates for realm" Error, because some Scripter "loves" this "bug" :o/

function.name: ReleaseItem
function.explain: Releases an item previously reserved by ReserveItem().
function.error: "That item is not reserved by this script." if item is not reserved (using ReserveItem())
"That item is not reserved." if the item is not "in use"

function.name: ReserveItem
function.return: 1 Item has been reserved by me. 2 Item was already reserved by me. Or Error

function.name: AssignRectToWeatherRegion
function.prototype: AssignRectToWeatherRegion( region, xwest, ynorth, xeast, ysouth )
function.explain: Sets the range for weather region named "region". Useful for making moving storms. Notes: Weather region strings as defined in regions/weather.cfg

function.name: GetRegionLightLevelAtLocation

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Get lightlevel of [light] region for coordinates.
function.return: Integer value of lightlevel on success

function.name: GetRegionName
function.explain: Get name of [justice] region that Object is in.
function.return: String value of "Region Name" on success

function.name: GetRegionNameAtLocation

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Get name of [justice] region for coordinates.
function.return: String value of "Region Name" on success

function.name: GetRegionString
function.prototype: GetRegionString( resource, x, y, propertyname, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Allows you to look up custom properties within a resource region entry.

"resource" is a string that matches a resource type in regions/resource.cfg, i.e. "ore". x,y is the coordinate to look up in the regions defined in resources/ore.cfg (or the filename matching the supplied resource).

"property_name" is the _custom_ property to match (i.e. UnitsPerArea, SecondsPerRegrow, Capacity, Range are NOT matched) in the found region.
Example: in regions/resource.cfg there exists a ResourceType "ore". In ore.cfg there exists a region: Region Outer Covetous { UnitsPerArea 15 SecondsPerRegrow 300 Capacity 20000 Range 2299 784 2635 967 Prop value_string -- this is a custom property not used by the core } GetRegionString("ore",2299,785,"Prop"); would return "value_string"
function.error: "No resource by that name" if "resource" not found in regions/resource.cfg
"No resource region at that location" if the given x,y is not defined inside any of the regions in regions/[resource string].cfg
"Property not found" if "propertyname" was not found in the matching region.

function.name: SetRegionWeatherLevel
function.prototype: SetRegionWeatherLevel( region, type, severity, aux := 0, lightoverride := -1)

parameter.name: aux
parameter.value: integer (optional, see above for default values)

parameter.name: lightoverride
parameter.value: integer (optional, see above for default values)

function.explain: Sets the weather effects for a given weather region.

explain.code:
Notes: Weather values by Tharaxis type: 0 - light rain ("It starts to rain") 1 - rain/thunder ("A fierce storm approaches") 2 - snow ("It begins to snow") 3 - brewing storm - ("A storm is brewing") 255 - None (Turns sound effects off)
severity:is set on a 0-70 scale, 70=torrential rain, 0=light drizzle. aux: ??? lightoverride: light level amount overrides current level. -1 means no override.

function.error: "Weather region not found" if "region" not found in regions/weather.cfg

function.name: CreateAccount
function.explain: Creates a new player account with the specified account name, password.
Notes: If enabled == 0, player cannot log in.
Only accepts Alphanumeric characters for account name. Control characters, '{' '}', and spaces not allowed.
Passwords cannot contain whitespace or control characters.
function.return: Account Reference for the new account on success
function.error: "Attempted to create account with non-alphanumeric characters."
"Attempted to use password in account creation with non-allowed characters."

function.name: FindAccount
function.explain: Gets a player Account Reference by the name of the account.

function.name: ListAccounts
function.explain: Gets a list of all account names.
function.return: Array of Strings of account names.

function.name: DestroyMulti
function.explain: Deletes a Multi item from the world.
Notes: House: Moves all characters and items inside multi to ground. Boat: Requires hold be empty, deck be empty, and have no mobiles logged-out on boat.
function.error: "WTF!? Don't know what kind of multi that is!" if not a boat or a house
Boat Errors:"There is cargo in the ship's hold"
"There are logged-out characters on the deck"

function.name: DisableEvents

parameter.name: eventtype
parameter.value: integer combination (bitwise-OR) of constants from SYSEVENT.INC

function.explain: Disables the system event(s) defined in sysevent.inc for the current NPC or item control script. Do not use for "user" events (see EnableEvents()).

function.name: SendEvent
function.explain: Sends the integer event (either a combination of system events, or one user-defined event) to the NPC's control script.
function.error: "That NPC doesn't have a control script"

function.name: SendHousingTool
function.explain: Sends the custom housing tool to Character
house.setcustom(1) is needed before SendHousingTool() works
during editing chr is only allowed to walk inside the house

all components which are not invisible get removed from component list during edit and added to design (not invisible to give the chance to eg protect a house sign from been removed from the editing char)
any item inside the house will be invisible for the chr
any other mobiles get moved outside the house
param houseelemarray in script call is the current list of houseparts, multi.house_parts gives you the last stored list
until no house.acceptcommit() is called and start of commitscript no new SendHousingTool() for this house is allowed

function.name: ApplyConstraint
function.explain: Each element's objtype in "objlist" is looked up in the config file referenced by "configfile". if the object's value for "propertyname" is less than "minvalue", its objtype is included in the returned array.
function.return: An Array of Object Types that pass the constraint.
function.error: none (instead returns an Uninitialized Object on failure)

function.name: GetCommandHelp
function.explain: Gets a help message for a textcommand, if one is defined.
Notes: Help files are found in commandname.txt in the same directory as the command script.

function.name: GetMenuObjTypes
function.explain: Gets all the objtypes contained in the menu.
Notes: see CreateMenu(), AddMenuItem()
function.return: Array of objtypes contained in the given menu.

function.name: SetScriptController
function.explain: Set the "controller" of the current script to "who".
Notes: This is used to know, for instance, who the fire field walk-on script belongs to so that the reputation/criminal system knows who to punish.
pass 0 to clear the script controller.
function.return: Character Reference of the "old" controller of the script.

function.name: SingleClick
function.explain: Emulates a single click of the character "who" on the object or character "what".
Note: "what" can be a serial.

function.name: GetSpellDifficulty
function.explain: Gets spell "difficulty" based on spell circle number (config/circles.cfg).
Notes: spells.cfg files define spells and spell ids. "Difficulty" values are used in the function CheckSkill()

function.name: SpeakPowerWords
function.explain: Forces character "who" to speak the spell power words as defined in spells.cfg.
Notes: spells.cfg files define spells and spell ids.
See client.inc for font and color values.

function.name: StartSpellEffect
function.explain: Starts the spell script as defined in spells.cfg
Notes: spells.cfg files define spells and spell ids.

function.name: DisconnectClient
function.explain: Disconnects the character's client.
Notes: Fun!

function.name: ListEquippedItems
function.explain: Returns a list of items current equipped on character referenced by "who"
function.return: Array of Item References equipped on "who"

function.name: ListHostiles
function.explain: Gets a list of Character References that are hostile (i.e. attacking) "character"

Notes: from uo.em constants:
const LH_FLAG_LOS := 1; // only include those in LOS const LH_FLAG_INCLUDE_HIDDEN := 2; // include hidden characters
Will NOT find "concealed" characters.
function.return: Array of Character References hostile to "character"

function.name: OpenPaperdoll
function.explain: Sends the paperdoll gump to a character.
Notes: "towhom" gets the paperdoll for character "forwhom"

function.name: SelectColor
function.explain: Sends a color chooser gump to character.

Notes: Function blocks until character cancels or selects a color from the chooser gump. No validation is done by the core. Might be useful to check if the color returned is >1001 (out of range for the chooser gump).
function.return: Integer of selected color. use item.color = return_value to set.

function.name: SendBuyWindow
function.prototype: SendBuyWindow( character, container, vendor, items, flags := 0 )

parameter.name: container
parameter.value: Container Reference ( vendor 'for sale items' container )

function.explain: Sends the "buy scroll" gump to a player to choose items to buy.
Notes: Pretty nasty function. Containers should be in storage areas.

Notes: Core will send Item Description using AoS Tooltips in any case if flag VENDOR_SEND_AOS_TOOLTIP is set. This will correct problems with Item Descriptions in newer Clients, but maybe freeze ancient Clients...

Notes: uo.em constants for this function:
const VENDOR_SEND_AOS_TOOLTIP := 0x01;
function.error: "Too much crap in vendor's inventory!" (message exceeds 2000 byte buffer)

function.name: SendDialogGump
function.prototype: SendDialogGump( who, layout, textlines, x := 0, y := 0, flags := 0, gumpid := 0 )
function.explain: Sends a generic gump window to "who" and waits for the user's input.
If no gumpid is given, the script's pid will be sent as gumpid.

Notes: "layout" is an array of strings with each string a gump layout directive. "textlines" is an array of strings with text that is displayed on the gump. "Layout" references this array in a 0-based manner. Creating these arrays is difficult and hard to debug. See the "gumps" package for a more user- friendly interface to gumps.
Based on clientversion core will send compressed or uncompressed version

Notes: uo.em constants for this function:
const SENDDIALOGMENU_FORCE_OLD := 0x01;
function.return: the return value is a dictionary. return[0] contains the button ID the user used to close the gump. 0 is returned if the gump was cancelled. return.keys contains the IDs for the radio buttons, checkboxes, and textentries set when the gump was returned. Note control characters are stripped from the text input lines.

function.name: SendInstaResDialog
function.explain: Character's screen fades to black, "You are Dead" appears, Character gets menu choice for Instares.
Notes: (Rac) Could not get menu dialog to appear, "Play as ghost" returned to server no matter what. "AssumePlayAsGhost" in uo.cfg made no difference.

function.name: SendOpenBook
function.explain: Sends a book gump to the character.

The 'book' passed must have a Method Script, exporting the following functions: exported function IsWritable(book) // returns 0 or 1 for readonly/writable exported function GetNumLines(book) // returns maximum number of lines exported function GetTitle(book) // returns title as string exported function GetAuthor(book) //returns author as string exported function GetLine(book, line) // line is 1-based

Writable books must provide the following functions: exported function SetAuthor(book,author) exported function SetTitle(book,title) exported function SetLine(book,line,text) exported function GetContents(book) // returns an array of all lines

function.name: SendOpenSpecialContainer
function.explain: Sends an open container gump to the character.

Notes: DANGEROUS FUNCTION. Normally only used to show "inaccessable" containers like bankboxes. If used on normal containers, it allows the character to both view and change the contents. See SendViewContainer().

function.name: SendPacket
function.explain: Sends the hex string to the character as a binary packet.
Notes: Development function, use at your own risk. The string is in a form like: SendPacket(who,"BC0401") would cause the season to change to "desolation"

function.name: SendSellWindow
function.prototype: SendSellWindow( character, vendor, i1, i2, i3, flags := 0 )
function.explain: Sends a sell scroll gump to "character" using "vendor" as the merchant.
Notes: i1 = vendor's "For sale" item containter. i2 = vendor's "Bought from player" item container. i3 = vendor's "Buyable" item container.

Notes: Core will send Item Description using AoS Tooltips in any case if flag VENDOR_SEND_AOS_TOOLTIP is set. This will correct problems with Item Descriptions in newer Clients, but maybe freeze ancient Clients...

Notes: uo.em constants for this function:
const VENDOR_SEND_AOS_TOOLTIP := 0x01;

function.name: SendSkillWindow
function.explain: Sends a skills scroll gump to "towhom"
Notes: The skills belong to "forwhom" and are sent to "towhom"

function.name: SendStringAsTipWindow
function.explain: Sends "text" to "character" in a tip-window gump.
Text needs to be in "MAC" format: CR at the end of each line.

function.name: SendTextEntryGump
function.prototype: SendTextEntryGump( who, line1, cancel := TE_CANCEL_ENABLE, style := TE_STYLE_NORMAL, maximum := 40, line2 := "" )
function.explain: Sends a text-entry gump to "who" with the specified option, style, and informational string.
function.return: A String on success 0 if gump was cancelled.

function.name: SendViewContainer
function.explain: Sends the container's open gump and contents to the character.
Notes: Use this for normal containers.

function.name: PlayMovingEffectXYZ
function.prototype: PlayMovingEffectXYZ( srcx, srcy, srcz, dstx, dsty, dstz, effect, speed, loop := 0, explode := 0, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Starts a moving effect between the source and destination coordinates.

Notes: "effect" is a UO graphic number (the first graphic in a series for an animated effect) "speed" controls the time between frames of animation "loop" controls the number of total frames to play in the animation (loops if greater than the length of the animation). 0 = play once. "explode" flags if an explosion effect should be played at the end of the animation

function.name: PlaySoundEffectPrivate
function.explain: Plays a sound effect only heard by "playfor", centered around "object"
Notes: see client.inc for sound IDs (or InsideUO)

function.name: PlayStationaryEffect
function.prototype: PlayStationaryEffect( x, y, z, effect, speed, loop := 0, explode := 0, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Starts a stationary graphic effect at x,y,z.

Notes: "effect" is a UO graphic number (the first graphic in a series for an animated effect) "speed" controls the time between frames of animation "loop" controls the number of total frames to play in the animation (loops if greater than the length of the animation). 0 = play once. "explode" flags if an explosion effect should be played at the end of the animation

function.name: POLCore
function.explain: Returns a Polcore object. See object reference for object methods.

function.name: GetMapInfo

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Gets information about map data at a location.
Notes: Tells you nothing about Static items! z = map height at x,y. Not necessarily the same as GetStandingHeight() landtile = the land tile type number at x,y (not an item graphic number)

function.name: GetStandingHeight

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Gets the lowest z height value one could stand at x,y starting at "startz".

Notes: For example, if there is a static tunnel under the map, using a startz value less than the tunnel floor would get you the z of the floor. Above that value would get you the next possible standing height (i.e. on the map above). Also returns a multi reference if a multi exists at that location.
function.return: A Struct with members "z" and possibly "multi" (a Multi Reference)

function.name: GetWorldHeight

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Gets the lowest standing height at x,y
function.return: z value of lowest standing height
function.error: "Nowhere" if one could not stand at any z value of x,y

function.name: Shutdown
function.explain: Shuts down the server
Notes: Disconnects all clients and saves the world state. The POL process will exit with the provided exit_code.

function.name: Accessible
function.explain: Function: Determines if an item falls into one of the following categories for a character:
An item on the ground, within "range" squares (defaults to "DefaultAccessibleRange" from servspecopt). Use ACCESSIBLE_IGNOREDISTANCE to avoid this check.
An item equipped by the character
An item inside the character's backpack
A temporarily accessible item
Notes: Does not check that character has line-of-sight to item.
function.return: 0 if item does not fall into one of the above categories, 1 if the item does.

function.name: Broadcast
function.explain: Sends text as a System Message to every online player whos cmd level is above requiredcmdlevel.
See client.inc for font and color values.

function.name: CheckLineOfSight
function.explain: Tests if object1 has Line-of-sight to object 2
function.return: 1 if object1 has LOS to object2

function.name: CancelTarget
function.explain: If the character has a current Target Reference, it sends the cancel packet. Client response to the original target cursor's script is as if they hit Escape.
function.error: "Client does not have an active target cursor"

function.name: CheckLosAt
function.explain: Tests if character has Line-of-sight to coordinate
function.return: 0 if character does not have line-of-sight to (x,y,z)

function.name: CloseTradeWindow
function.explain: Attempts to close the Trade Window a client has open.
function.error: "Mobile is not currently trading with anyone."

function.name: CreateItemAtLocation
function.prototype: CreateItemAtLocation( x, y, z, objtype, amount := 1, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

parameter.name: objtype
parameter.value: Integer objtype, OR String ObjtypeName, OR GetItemDescriptor struct.

function.explain: Creates an item at an arbitrary location.
Amount specifies how large the stack should be.
Runs the item's create script, if any.
function.error: "That item is not stackable. Create one at a time."
"Unable to create item of objtype X"

function.name: CreateItemInBackpack

parameter.name: objtype
parameter.value: Integer objtype, OR String ObjtypeName, OR GetItemDescriptor struct.

function.explain: Creates an item in a character's backpack.

Notes: Adds to an existing stack in the top level of the container, if an appropriate stack can be found (meaning, can hold the new amount, the existing item stack has color equal to its itemdesc.cfg color property AND has equal CProps as its itemdesc.cfg entry (not counting locally and globally ignored cprops). If no appropritate stack is found, creates a new stack.
Runs the item's create script, if any.
Calls the container's canInsert and onInsert scripts, if any.
function.error: "That item is not stackable. Create one at a time."

function.name: CreateItemInContainer

parameter.name: objtype
parameter.value: Integer objtype, OR String ObjtypeName, OR GetItemDescriptor struct.

function.explain: Creates an item in a container.

Notes: Adds to an existing stack in the top level of the container, if an appropriate stack can be found (meaning, can hold the new amount, the existing item stack has color equal to its itemdesc.cfg color property AND has equal CProps as its itemdesc.cfg entry (not counting locally and globally ignored cprops). If no appropritate stack is found, creates a new stack.
Runs the item's create script, if any.
Calls the container's canInsert and onInsert scripts, if any.
function.error: "That item is not stackable. Create one at a time."

function.name: CreateNpcFromTemplate
function.prototype: CreateNpcFromTemplate( template, x, y, z, override_properties := 0, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM)

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

parameter.name: override_properties
parameter.value: A Struct with keys as String members and values as appropriate (see notes)

function.explain: Creates an NPC from a template (found in NPCDESC.CFG).

Notes: override_properties: a structure containing members to override values in the NPC template. This can be used to override built-in properties (facing, color, gender etc) and custom properties ("CProps" = dictionary {key=cpropname value=cpropvalue})
forceposition: if true, the NPC will be created even in an invalid location.
function.error: "Parameter 4 must be a Struct or Integer(0)"
"Not a valid location for an NPC!"
"Exception detected trying to create npc from template 'X'"

function.name: Detach
function.explain: Disassociates the current script from the character that it is attached to. See Attach() too.
If the current script is not attached to a character, does nothing.
function.return: 1 on success (the script was attached to a character, and is no longer.)

function.name: Distance
function.explain: Determines the distance between two objects. If either object is in a container, uses the world-position of its ultimate-parent container.
Notes: This distance is defined as the greater of the x-distance and the y-distance. z-distance is not taken into account. (This is neither Pythagorean distance nor Manhattan distance)

function.name: EnumerateItemsInContainer
function.explain: Returns an array of the contents of a container.
Notes: If 'container' is itself locked, its contents will still be enumerated.

Notes: uo.em constant for this function:
const ENUMERATE_IGNORE_LOCKED := 0x1; // List content of locked container const ENUMERATE_ROOT_ONLY := 0x2; // Do not list contents of sub-containers.
function.return: An Array of Item References on success

function.name: EnumerateOnlineCharacters
function.explain: Gets a list of all online player characters.
function.return: An Array of Character References on success

function.name: EquipFromTemplate
function.explain: Creates equipment for a character, using EQUIP.CFG.

Notes: Element properties in EQUIP.CFG can have the following formats: Equip [hex_objtype] [hex_color] Armor [armor_template_name] Weapon [weapon_template_name] Note that object type and color must be in hex format (0xHHHH)
Will not create an item that is not equippable.
function.error: "Blech! Can't find '[object name]' named in equip.cfg"

function.name: GetAmount
function.explain: Returns size of item stack.
probably better to use item.amount
function.return: Integer size of item's stack on success

function.name: GrantPrivilege
function.explain: Grants a privilege to a character.
Notes: see some other doc for a list of privs and their functions
function.return: 1 f the privilege was granted successfully

function.name: ListGhostsNearLocation
function.prototype: ListGhostsNearLocation( x, y, z, range, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Searches the world for ghosts within "range" squares of (x,y,z).

Notes: 19 is used for the z-range. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently This call is equivalent to ListMobilesNearLocationEx( x, y, z, range, LISTEX_GHOST, realm ). For this reason, this function is depreciated.
function.return: An array of Character References of ghosts found near the location on success

function.name: ListItemsNearLocation
function.prototype: ListItemsNearLocation( x, y, z, range, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Searches the world for items within range squares of (x,y,z).
Notes: 19 is used for the Z-Range or use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently.
function.return: <uninitialized object> if invalid parameters, or Array of Item References of Items found near the location.

function.name: ListItemsNearLocationOfType
function.prototype: ListItemsNearLocationOfType( x, y, z, range, objtype, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Searches the world for items within range squares of (x,y,z) of type objtype.
Notes: 19 is used for the Z-Range or use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently.
function.return: <uninitialized object> if invalid parameters, or Array of Item References of Items matching "objtype" found near the location.

function.name: ListMobilesInLineOfSight
function.explain: Gets list of mobiles in line of sight of "object", maximum "range" tiles away.
Notes: Finds living, non-hidden mobiles within range tiles of object, that have LOS with it.
function.return: An Array of Character References on success

function.name: ListMobilesNearLocation
function.prototype: ListMobilesNearLocation( x, y, z, range, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Searches the world for mobiles within range squares of (x,y,z).
Notes: Finds living, non-hidden mobiles found near the location.
Notes: 19 is used for the Z-Range or use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently.

function.name: ListMobilesNearLocationEx
function.prototype: ListMobilesNearLocationEx( x, y, z, range, flags, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Searches the world for mobiles within range squares of (x,y,z).
Notes: 19 is used for the Z-Range or use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently.
function.return: An Array of Character References of mobiles found matching the search criteria.

function.name: ListOfflineMobilesInRealm

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: returns the list of offline mobiles in a specific realm.
Useful for moving the offline mobiles out of a shadow realm before deleting it.
function.return: An Array of Character References of mobiles found.

function.name: PrintTextAbove
function.prototype: PrintTextAbove( above_object, text, font := _DEFAULT_TEXT_FONT, color := _DEFAULT_TEXT_COLOR, journal_print := JOURNAL_PRINT_NAME)
function.explain: Prints text above an object, as if spoken.
Notes: see client.inc for suitable values for font and color

Notes: journal_print flags:
const JOURNAL_PRINT_NAME := 0x00; // Implicit. Print's the object's description / npc's name in the journal. const JOURNAL_PRINT_YOU_SEE := 0x01; // Will print "You see:" in the journal.
function.return: 0 if text was too long (>200 characters)

function.name: PrintTextAbovePrivate
function.prototype: PrintTextAbovePrivate( above_object, text, character, font := _DEFAULT_TEXT_FONT, color := _DEFAULT_TEXT_COLOR, journal_print := JOURNAL_PRINT_NAME )
function.explain: Causes text to be displayed above "above_object", as if spoken. This text will only be seen by a single character referenced by "character"
Notes: see client.inc for suitable values for font and color

Notes: journal_print flags:
const JOURNAL_PRINT_NAME := 0x00; // Implicit. Print's the object's description / npc's name in the journal. const JOURNAL_PRINT_YOU_SEE := 0x01; // Will print "You see:" in the journal.
function.return: 0 if text was too long (>200 characters)

function.name: ReadGameClock
function.explain: Returns the total number of seconds the server has been active.

Notes: The Game Clock is a seconds-counter. It is started after all data is read, and is stopped just before writing data. It has no relationship to real-world calendar time. It counts real-time seconds - if the system is running slow, it will reliably tell you how many real-time seconds have passed while the game was running.
function.return: Integer - The current value of the game clock.

function.name: RequestInput
function.explain: Prompts a player for input, and waits for the player to type a line of text.
Notes: "item" is a placeholder - the client needs it, but it is not used internally. Typically some related item will be passed.
function.return: A String containing the next line of text from the client's keyboard on success. Returns 0 (int) if control characters were found in the string.

function.name: RestartScript
function.explain: Stops the current master script for an NPC, and starts a new one.
npc.script can be assigned before calling this, to change the master script for an NPC.

function.name: Resurrect
function.return: 1 if the ghost was resurrected successfully

function.name: RevokePrivilege
function.explain: Revokes a privilege from a character.
function.return: 1 if the privilege was revoked, or if it was not previously granted.

function.name: SaveWorldState
function.explain: Saves the current world state.

function.name: SendSysMessage
function.explain: Displays a System Message in the lower-left corner of character's player's screen.
Notes: see client.inc for suitable values of font and color.

function.name: SetRegionLightLevel
function.explain: Sets the light level of a region by name.
Notes: lightlevel must be a value between 0 and 30 where 0 is daylight and 30 is near-total darkness. regionname must match a region name from REGIONS\LIGHT.CFG.
function.return: 1 if the light level was set successfully

function.name: SystemFindObjectBySerial
function.explain: Searches the world for an item or mobile by serial number. This could be used if the serial number of an object was saved with SetObjProperty, for example.

Notes: uo.em constants for flags:
const SYSFIND_SEARCH_OFFLINE_MOBILES := 1;
function.return: A Character Reference, Item Reference, or Multi reference on success.

function.name: Target
function.explain: Sends a target cursor to "by_character"'s client, and waits for the player to target something.
Notes: Options control Line-of-sight checking.
0 is returned if the character does not have line-of-sight to the object.

The first 2 options specify if Line-of-sight to the targetting obejct should be checked or not. The last 3 options are involved with the reputation system. Use TGTOPT_HARMFUL if the effect that uses the target is a hostile action (like casting fireball), use _HELPFUL for things like healing and use _NEUTRAL for reputation-neutral actions.
function.return: 0 if user cancelled, or nothing targetted, or no LOS to target (if option is selected)
UObject Reference on success (item or character or multi)

function.name: TargetCoordinates
function.explain: Sends a target cursor to a character's client, and waits for the player to target a ground tile.
Notes: Line-of-sight is not checked.
function.return: A Structure on success: members: structure.x,structure.y,structure.z,structure.realm - containing the location targetted. structure.objtype - containing the objtype of the static object targetted.
structure.item contains an Item Reference to a dynamic item targetted.
structure.mobile contains a Character Reference to a mobile targetted.
structure.multi contains Multi Reference if coords are inside a multi
0 if the target cursor was cancelled or the client disconnected.

function.name: AddMenuItem

parameter.name: objtype
parameter.value: Integer tile graphic to add to menu

function.explain: Adds a menu item to a dynamic menu.

Notes: The 'objtype' field of a mobile is not appropriate here. There is special art for mobiles for use in menus. Human Males (object type: 0x190) use 0x2106, females 0x2107. Use InsideUO to determine other values. Color defaults to 0 if no itemdesc.cfg entry exists. Hint: menus.cfg uses the color of the itemdesc entry of the objtype given.
0 for objtype creates a checkbox-style menu
function.return: 1 if the item was added successfully

function.name: CreateMenu
function.explain: Creates an empty dynamic "old-style item selection" menu.
function.return: A dynamic menu reference if the menu was created successfully

function.name: SelectMenuItem2

parameter.name: menuname
parameter.value: String name of the static menu in menus.cfg, or a dynamic menu reference

function.explain: Displays an object menu on the character's client for the player to select from.
Notes: Can take a static or dynamic menu.
function.return: 0 if the menu was cancelled, or the character's client disconnected.

A Structure on success: .objtype = Integer object type of the selection. .index = 1-based index within the menu of the selection. .graphic = Integer graphic of the object. .color = color of the object.
function.error: "Client is busy, or menu is empty"

function.name: EraseObjProperty
function.explain: Removes a property from the custom-property ("cprop") list of an object. propertyname is case-sensative
function.return: 1 if the property was erased or did not exist.

function.name: GetObjProperty
function.explain: Retrieves custom data (a "cprop") associated with an object. propertyname is case-sensative
function.return: On success, the unpacked object that was saved with SetObjProperty. This could be a string, integer, real, array, struct, dictionary, etc.

function.name: SetObjProperty

parameter.name: property_value
parameter.value: a script object (could be string, int, real, array, etc)

function.explain: Sets a custom data property on an object. This data will be saved with the object, for later retrieval with GetObjProperty. propertyname is case-sensative

function.name: EraseGlobalProperty
function.explain: Removes a property from the global property list. propertyname is case-sensative
function.return: 1 if the property was erased or did not exist.

function.name: GetGlobalProperty
function.explain: Retrieves the value of a global property. propertyname is case-sensative
function.return: On success a script object (string, integer, real, array, etc) containing the value of the named property

function.name: SetGlobalProperty

parameter.name: propval
parameter.value: a script object (could be string, int, real, array, etc)

function.explain: Sets the value of a global property. propertyname is case-sensative

function.name: GetGlobalPropertyNames
function.explain: Gets all the global property names. Use GetGlobalProperty(returned_array[i]) to get the property value.

function.name: PerformAction
function.prototype: PerformAction( character, action, framecount := 5, repeatcount := 1, backward := ACTION_DIR_FORWARD, repeatflag := ACTION_NOREPEAT, delay := 1 )
function.explain: Causes character to perform an action, such as Bow or Salute.
Notes: see client.inc for valid action IDs

function.name: PlayLightningBoltEffect
function.explain: Plays a lightning bolt effect centered on the object.

function.name: PlayMovingEffect
function.prototype: PlayMovingEffect( source, target, effect, speed, loop := 0, explode := 0 )
function.explain: Causes a moving effect to be played, travelling from source to destination

Notes: effect = an item graphic number (the first in a series if an animation) speed = how fast the effect should travel. loop = 0/1 loop the animation? explode = 0/1 show an explosion at destination at the end of the effect?

function.name: PlayObjectCenteredEffect
function.explain: Causes an effect to be played, centered on uobject, which follows uobject if it moves.
Notes: see PlayMovingEffect for effect, speed, loop description This is used for effects like flame strike and reactive armor.

function.name: PlaySoundEffect
function.explain: Causes a sound effect to be played, centered on object.
Notes: see client.inc for sound effect constants
All clients within a range of 18 tiles are sent this command. Use PlaySoundEffectPrivate() for private sounds.

function.name: PlaySoundEffectXYZ
function.prototype: PlaySoundEffectXYZ( x, y, z, effect, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Causes a sound effect to be played, centered on Location.
Notes: see client.inc for sound effect constants
All clients within a range of 18 tiles are sent this command. Use PlaySoundEffectPrivate() for private sounds.

function.name: DestroyItem
function.explain: Removes an item from the world. Transmits commands to each client in range of item to reflect this.
Notes: runs the Item's destroy script, if any.
function.return: 0 if the item's destroy script disallowed destruction

function.name: EquipItem
function.explain: Equips an item on a mobile.
Notes: If item is in a container, it will be removed from the container.
"Equippable" means that the character does not have a similar item equipped, and that the item is an equipment-type item.
Carrying-capacity and strength requirements will fall under this category as well.
To "unequip" an item, move it to another location (typically a backpack)
Runs the Item's Equiptest and Equip scripts, if any.
function.return: 1 if the item was equipped succesfully
0 if the item's Equip script returned false
function.error: "That item is not equippable by that character" if equiptest script failed.

function.name: MoveItemToContainer
function.prototype: MoveItemToContainer( item, container, x := -1, y := -1, add_to_existing_stack := 0 )

parameter.name: add_to_existing_stack
parameter.value: Defines if the items moved to the container will look for an existing stack and add to it or just add as a new item ( old behaviour )

function.explain: Moves an item into a container.

Notes: If the default values for x and y are passed, or if x or y does not fall within the legal bounds for a container as found in ITEMDESC.CFG, then a random location within the container will be chosen.
Calls the item's unequiptest and unequip scripts, if any.
Calls the container's canInsert and onInsert scripts, if any.
Calls the item's original container's (if any) canRemove and onRemove scripts, if any.
If add_to_existing_stack == 1 and there is no stack in the container, it will return Error "There is no existing stack", so its up to scripts to check this.
If add_to_existing_stack == 2 and there is no stack in the container, it will just add as a new item like when add_to_existing_stack == 0.
function.error: "Can't put a container into an item in itself"
"Container is too full to add that"

function.name: SubtractAmount
function.explain: Decreases the stack size of an item. If nothing is left, deletes the item.

function.name: CreateMultiAtLocation
function.prototype: CreateMultiAtLocation( x, y, z, objtype, flags := 0, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

parameter.name: objtype
parameter.value: Integer objtype, OR String ObjtypeName, OR GetItemDescriptor struct.

function.explain: Creates a "multi" object (house or boat) at a location.

Notes: uo.em constants for flags:
houses only: const CRMULTI_IGNORE_MULTIS := 0x0001; //ignore intersecting multis const CRMULTI_IGNORE_OBJECTS := 0x0002; //ignore dynamic objects const CRMULTI_IGNORE_WORLDZ := 0x0004; //ignore standability,relative Z,world height const CRMULTI_IGNORE_ALL := 0x0007;
objtype must be a multi type as defined in itemdesc.cfg having a type House or Boat.

For Boats: Position must be passable - every part of the hull sits on water, and no hull location is occupied by the hull of another ship, nor a static or dynamic blocking item. Runs scripts/misc/boat.ecl on creation.
function.return: Boat Reference or House Reference on success, and adds the multi to the world
function.error: "Don't know what kind of multi to make"
"Multi definition not found for Boat, objtype=X, graphic=Y"
"No boatshape for Boat in boats.cfg, objtype=X, graphic=Y"
"Multi definition not found for House, objtype=X, graphic=Y"

function.name: TargetMultiPlacement
function.prototype: TargetMultiPlacement( character, objtype, flags := 0, xoffset := 0, yoffset := 0, hue := 0 )
function.explain: Sends character a "ghost" multi to select placement location in the world.
Notes: objtype must be from an itemdesc.cfg entry with a Boat or House type.
For House target placement, flags should == 0.
function.return: A Structure (x,y,z) containing the location targetted on success
function.error: "Object Type is out of range for Multis"

function.name: RegisterForSpeechEvents
function.explain: Player-character speech spoken within "range" tiles of "at_object" will generate speech events, which are sent to "at_object"'s control script (use wait_for_event() to retreive the event).
uo.em constants for flags: const LISTENPT_HEAR_GHOSTS := 0x01;

function.name: EnableEvents
function.explain: Enables events specified. When enabled events occur, they will be placed on the script's event queue, and must be read with wait_for_event. Events that were previously enabled will remain enabled.
Notes: See include/sysevent.inc for event type constants. DO NOT use this function for non-system event IDs. For user-created events, just send the event, no need to enable it first.
This function is useful only to NPCs and Items that have called RegisterForSpeechEvents.
Range is only used for certain events (currently speech, and entered/leftarea events)
Evmask is used to receive entered/leftarea caused only by PCs, NPCs, or both (the default)

function.name: GetHarvestDifficulty
function.prototype: GetHarvestDifficulty( resource, x, y, tiletype, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Determines the difficulty of harvesting a resource from location (x,y).
Notes: tiletype will typically be .objtype from TargetCoordinates() Checks the location for an object of type 'tiletype'. This tiletype may be a landtile or an object tile.
"resource" is something like "ore" "wood" "fish", etc. see regions/resource.cfg, regions/ore.cfg, etc.
Formula: random_int( (90 - (units * 80 / units_per_area_)) * 2 )
function.return: An integer difficulty level if resources exist.

function.name: HarvestResource
function.prototype: HarvestResource( resource, x, y, b, n, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Attempts to harvest a resource from a location.
Notes: Harvests a*b resource units, where 0 is less than or equal to 'a' and 'a' is less than or equal to n. Thus you can request 0-40 units in groups of 5, etc.
function.return: Integer number of resource units harvested if resources were harvested, or 0 if no resources were available.

function.name: CreateItemCopyAtLocation

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: makes a clone of the item referenced with "itemref" at location x,y,z. Copies member variables and CProps. Does not work with Multi objects. Does not copy a container's contents.
function.error: "This function does not work with Multi objects."

function.name: SendQuestArrow

parameter.name: to_whom
parameter.value: Character reference the arrow shows to

function.explain: Sends a "quest arrow" to the player that points at x,y
Passing 'x' and 'y' within map bounds will set the Quest Arrow to point at that location.
If the client is HSA (client version > 7.0.9), Multiple arrows can exist at one time. You can specify an id using the arrowid param otherwise one will be generated by the core.
Pass an 'x' and 'y' value of -1 well cancel the arrow, for HSA clients an arrow id is required to clear that specific arrow.

function.name: ListItemsNearLocationWithFlag
function.prototype: ListItemsNearLocationWithFlag( x, y, z, range, flags, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Gets an array of itemrefs if its graphic matches any of the OR'd flags passed. "flags" here are tiledata.mul flags for the item's graphic.

Tiledata.mul flags:
const TILEDATA_FLAG_BACKGROUND := 0x00000001; //Background const TILEDATA_FLAG_WEAPON := 0x00000002; //Weapon const TILEDATA_FLAG_TRANSPARENT := 0x00000004; //Transparent const TILEDATA_FLAG_TRANSLUCENT := 0x00000008; //Translucent const TILEDATA_FLAG_WALL := 0x00000010; //Wall const TILEDATA_FLAG_DAMAGING := 0x00000020; //Damaging const TILEDATA_FLAG_IMPASSABLE := 0x00000040; //Impassable const TILEDATA_FLAG_WET := 0x00000080; //Wet const TILEDATA_FLAG_UNK := 0x00000100; //Unknown const TILEDATA_FLAG_SURFACE := 0x00000200; //Surface const TILEDATA_FLAG_BRIDGE := 0x00000400; //Bridge const TILEDATA_FLAG_STACKABLE := 0x00000800; //Generic/Stackable const TILEDATA_FLAG_WINDOW := 0x00001000; //Window const TILEDATA_FLAG_NOSHOOT := 0x00002000; //No Shoot const TILEDATA_FLAG_PREFIX_A := 0x00004000; //Prefix A const TILEDATA_FLAG_PREFIX_AN := 0x00008000; //Prefix An const TILEDATA_FLAG_INTERNAL := 0x00010000; //Internal (things like hair, beards, etc) const TILEDATA_FLAG_FOLIAGE := 0x00020000; //Foliage const TILEDATA_FLAG_PARTIAL_HUE := 0x00040000; //Partial Hue const TILEDATA_FLAG_UNK1 := 0x00080000; //Unknown 1 const TILEDATA_FLAG_MAP := 0x00100000; //Map const TILEDATA_FLAG_CONTAINER := 0x00200000; //Container const TILEDATA_FLAG_WEARABLE := 0x00400000; //Wearable const TILEDATA_FLAG_LIGHTSOURCE := 0x00800000; //LightSource const TILEDATA_FLAG_ANIMATED := 0x01000000; //Animated const TILEDATA_FLAG_HOVEROVER := 0x02000000; //HoverOver (gargoyle flying tiles) const TILEDATA_FLAG_UNK2 := 0x04000000; //Unknown 2 const TILEDATA_FLAG_ARMOR := 0x08000000; //Armor const TILEDATA_FLAG_ROOF := 0x10000000; //Roof const TILEDATA_FLAG_DOOR := 0x20000000; //Door const TILEDATA_FLAG_STAIRBACK := 0x40000000; //StairBack const TILEDATA_FLAG_STAIRRIGHT := 0x80000000; //StairRight
Notes: 19 is used for the Z-Range or use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently.
function.return: Array of Item References of Items matching "flags" found near the location or Error.

function.name: ListMultisInBox

parameter.name: x1
parameter.value: integer, for north west upper corner of box

parameter.name: y1
parameter.value: integer, for north west upper corner of box

parameter.name: z1
parameter.value: integer, for north west upper corner of box

parameter.name: x2
parameter.value: integer, for south east lower corner of box

parameter.name: y2
parameter.value: integer, for south east lower corner of box

parameter.name: z2
parameter.value: integer, for south east lower corner of box

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Lists all multis inside an imaginary box (where a multi must have at least one 'static' piece inside the box)
Notes: This function will not generate "Invalid Coordinates for realm" Error, because some Scripter "loves" this "bug" :o/
function.return: Error or Array of all multis found inside the specified box.

function.name: SetName
function.explain: Sets name of item or mobile.

function.name: FindPath
function.prototype: FindPath( x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM, flags := FP_IGNORE_MOBILES, searchskirt := 5 )

parameter.name: x1
parameter.value: Integer world coordinates - start of the path

parameter.name: y1
parameter.value: Integer world coordinates - start of the path

parameter.name: z1
parameter.value: Integer world coordinates - start of the path

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Finds a path from start to destination and will return an array of coordinates, representing each step along the path from the next step to take from the start of the path to the actual destination. The coordinates are found in .x, .y, and .z.

Notes: The skirt around the square that is formed around the start of the path to the destination which represents the searchable area is set by searchskirt. Check out MaxPathFindRange in servspecopt.cfg too.
function.return: Error or Array of coordinates, representing each step along the path.

function.name: UseItem
function.explain: This will allow the item specified's use script to be run by the character specified. No checks are done for distance, or check for being a ghost, or anything else.

Warning: This function can also be called with NPC's as the character, but any use script that requires interactivity with it's user that is called on an NPC may have unpredictable results(dependant on the script).

function.name: GetMultiDimensions
function.explain: Returns struct with coords of _relative_ distances from center. xmin and ymin are _negative_.

function.name: FindSubstance
function.prototype: FindSubstance( container, objtype, amount, makeinuse := 0, flags := 0 )
function.explain: Search the given container for items of objtype in an amount equal or greater than the amount given (stackables can return greater than #).
If makeinuse is set to 1, then the items will be reserved.

uo.em constants for flags:
// FindSubstance constants const FINDSUBSTANCE_IGNORE_LOCKED := 0x1; // Find matches in locked containers const FINDSUBSTANCE_ROOT_ONLY := 0x2; // Do not find matches in sub-containers. const FINDSUBSTANCE_FIND_ALL := 0x4; // Find all matches ignoring given amount
function.return: If sufficient # of items have been found, those found (and possibly reserved) will be returned in an array.
function.error: "Not enough of that substance in container"

function.name: SecureTradeWin
function.explain: Init secure trade via script over long distances.
function.error: "You cannot trade with someone in war mode."
"You cannot trade while in war mode."
"That person is already involved in a trade."
"You are already involved in a trade."

function.name: MoveItemToSecureTradeWin
function.explain: Move item to secure trade window via script.
function.error: "Could not remove item from its container."

function.name: Attach
function.explain: Associates the current script to the character. See Detach() too.

function.name: ListStaticsAtLocation
function.prototype: ListStaticsAtLocation( x, y, z, flags := 0, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Returns a list of Static or Multi Items at the specified x,y,z.
Use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value.
function.return: Array of Structs with members "x", "y", "z", "objtype" and "hue" or Error.

function.name: ListStaticsNearLocation
function.prototype: ListStaticsNearLocation( x, y, z, range, flags := 0, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Searches the world for Static or Multi Items within range squares of (x,y,z).
Notes: 19 is used for the Z-Range or use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently.
function.return: Array of Structs with members "x", "y", "z", "objtype" and "hue" or Error.

function.name: ListStaticsNearLocationOfType
function.prototype: ListStaticsNearLocationOfType( x, y, z, range, objtype, flags := 0, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Searches the world for static items within range squares of (x,y,z) of type objtype.
Notes: 19 is used for the Z-Range or use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently.
function.return: Array of Structs with members "x", "y", "z", "objtype" and "hue" or Error.

function.name: ListStaticsNearLocationWithFlag
function.prototype: ListStaticsNearLocationWithFlag( x, y, z, range, flags, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Gets an array of items if its graphic matches any of the OR'd flags passed. "flags" here are tiledata.mul flags for the item's graphic.

Tiledata.mul flags:
const TILEDATA_FLAG_BACKGROUND := 0x00000001; //Background const TILEDATA_FLAG_WEAPON := 0x00000002; //Weapon const TILEDATA_FLAG_TRANSPARENT := 0x00000004; //Transparent const TILEDATA_FLAG_TRANSLUCENT := 0x00000008; //Translucent const TILEDATA_FLAG_WALL := 0x00000010; //Wall const TILEDATA_FLAG_DAMAGING := 0x00000020; //Damaging const TILEDATA_FLAG_IMPASSABLE := 0x00000040; //Impassable const TILEDATA_FLAG_WET := 0x00000080; //Wet const TILEDATA_FLAG_UNK := 0x00000100; //Unknown const TILEDATA_FLAG_SURFACE := 0x00000200; //Surface const TILEDATA_FLAG_BRIDGE := 0x00000400; //Bridge const TILEDATA_FLAG_STACKABLE := 0x00000800; //Generic/Stackable const TILEDATA_FLAG_WINDOW := 0x00001000; //Window const TILEDATA_FLAG_NOSHOOT := 0x00002000; //No Shoot const TILEDATA_FLAG_PREFIX_A := 0x00004000; //Prefix A const TILEDATA_FLAG_PREFIX_AN := 0x00008000; //Prefix An const TILEDATA_FLAG_INTERNAL := 0x00010000; //Internal (things like hair, beards, etc) const TILEDATA_FLAG_FOLIAGE := 0x00020000; //Foliage const TILEDATA_FLAG_PARTIAL_HUE := 0x00040000; //Partial Hue const TILEDATA_FLAG_UNK1 := 0x00080000; //Unknown 1 const TILEDATA_FLAG_MAP := 0x00100000; //Map const TILEDATA_FLAG_CONTAINER := 0x00200000; //Container const TILEDATA_FLAG_WEARABLE := 0x00400000; //Wearable const TILEDATA_FLAG_LIGHTSOURCE := 0x00800000; //LightSource const TILEDATA_FLAG_ANIMATED := 0x01000000; //Animated const TILEDATA_FLAG_HOVEROVER := 0x02000000; //HoverOver (gargoyle flying tiles) const TILEDATA_FLAG_UNK2 := 0x04000000; //Unknown 2 const TILEDATA_FLAG_ARMOR := 0x08000000; //Armor const TILEDATA_FLAG_ROOF := 0x10000000; //Roof const TILEDATA_FLAG_DOOR := 0x20000000; //Door const TILEDATA_FLAG_STAIRBACK := 0x40000000; //StairBack const TILEDATA_FLAG_STAIRRIGHT := 0x80000000; //StairRight
Notes: 19 is used for the Z-Range or use LIST_IGNORE_Z constant as Z Parameter to list all Items ignoring Z-Value. Rectangular range is used - x-range and y-range are compared independently.
function.return: Array of Structs with members "x", "y", "z", "objtype" and "hue" or Error.

function.name: GetStandingLayers
function.prototype: GetStandingLayers( x, y, flags := MAPDATA_FLAG_ALL, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Returns an Array of standing Layers and blocking Solids.

mapdata flags:
const MAPDATA_FLAG_NONE := 0x0000; // Nothing const MAPDATA_FLAG_MOVELAND := 0x0001; // Move Land const MAPDATA_FLAG_MOVESEA := 0x0002; // Move Sea const MAPDATA_FLAG_BLOCKSIGHT := 0x0004; // Block Sight const MAPDATA_FLAG_OVERFLIGHT := 0x0008; // Over Flight (gargoyle flying) const MAPDATA_FLAG_ALLOWDROPON := 0x0010; // Allow DropOn const MAPDATA_FLAG_GRADUAL := 0x0020; // Gradual const MAPDATA_FLAG_BLOCKING := 0x0040; // Blocking const MAPDATA_FLAG_MORE_SOLIDS := 0x0080; // List more Solids
const MAPDATA_FLAG_WALKBLOCK := 0x0057; // Move Land, Move Sea, Blocking, Block Sight, Allow DropOn const MAPDATA_FLAG_MOVE_FLAGS := 0x0063; // Move Land, Move Sea, Blocking, Gradual const MAPDATA_FLAG_DROP_FLAGS := 0x0050; // Blocking, Allow DropOn const MAPDATA_FLAG_ALL := 0xffffffff; // All
function.return: Array of Structs with members "z", "height" and "flags" at that location or Error.

function.name: SendStatus
function.explain: Send full Status Packet to support Extensions like Resistances, if you add'em via Packet Hook. Use SendStatus to update'em.

function.name: MoveObjectToLocation
function.prototype: MoveObjectToLocation( object, x, y, z, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM, flags := MOVEOBJECT_NORMAL )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Moves an Object to a location in the world and/or from one realm to another realm.
Function will replace MoveCharacterToLocation(), MoveItemToLocation(), and MoveObjectToRealm().
Currently moves boats, mobiles, and items.

Notes: If MOVEOBJECT_FORCELOCATION is not passed with flags, z-coordinate passed is used as a hint. The object will be placed on the the ground, or on an item, or on a ship. If it is set, the z location of the object is forced.
Notes: If MOVEITEM_IGNOREMOVABLE is set movable member is ignored.
Notes: If item is equipped, its unequiptest and unequip scripts are run, if any.
Notes: Calls the item's original container's canRemove and onRemove scripts, if any.
function.error: Can't move multis at this time.
"Location (x, y, z) is out of bounds"
"Could not remove item from its container."

function.name: CoordinateDistance
function.explain: Calculates the distance between two coordinates.

function.name: GetCoordsInLine
function.explain: Calculates every coordinate between the two points.

function.name: GetFacing
function.explain: Returns the facing number an object must have in order to face to_x and to_y from from_x and from_y.

function.name: PlayMovingEffectEx
function.prototype: PlayMovingEffectEx( source, target, effect, speed, duration := 0, hue := 0, render := 0, fixeddirection := 0, explode := 0, effect3d := 0, effect3dexplode := 0, effect3dsound := 0 )
function.explain: Causes a moving effect to be played, travelling from source to destination
effect3d,effect3dexplode,effect3dsound are only interpreted by the 3D client
effect3dexplode and effect3dsound are only interpreted if explode is set, effect3d and effect3dexplode values can be found in client/particles dir.

Notes: effect = an item graphic number (the first in a series if an animation) speed = how fast the effect should travel. explode = 0/1 show an explosion at destination at the end of the effect? hue = which color should the effect have? fixeddirection = 0/1 should the effect change his facing?
render values are:
0 no change
1 It becomes dark
2 It becomes bright
3 Bright color is emphasized and dark color is converted transparently
4 The translucency (transparency is high)
5 The translucency (it is close to primary color)
6 Negative positive reversal
7 The background which is transparent negative positive reversal

function.name: PlayMovingEffectXYZEx
function.prototype: PlayMovingEffectXYZEx( srcx, srcy, srcz, dstx, dsty, dstz, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM, effect, speed, duration := 0, hue := 0, render := 0, fixeddirection := 0, explode := 0, effect3d := 0, effect3dexplode := 0, effect3dsound := 0 )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Causes a moving effect to be played, travelling from source to destination
effect3d,effect3dexplode,effect3dsound are only interpreted by the 3D client
effect3dexplode and effect3dsound are only interpreted if explode is set, effect3d and effect3dexplode values can be found in client/particles dir.

Notes: effect = an item graphic number (the first in a series if an animation) speed = how fast the effect should travel. explode = 0/1 show an explosion at destination at the end of the effect? hue = which color should the effect have? fixeddirection = 0/1 should the effect change his facing?
render values are:
0 no change
1 It becomes dark
2 It becomes bright
3 Bright color is emphasized and dark color is converted transparently
4 The translucency (transparency is high)
5 The translucency (it is close to primary color)
6 Negative positive reversal
7 The background which is transparent negative positive reversal

function.name: PlayObjectCenteredEffectEx
function.prototype: PlayObjectCenteredEffectEx( center, effect, speed, duration := 0, hue := 0, render := 0, layer := 0, effect3d := 0 )
function.explain: Causes an effect to be played, centered on uobject, which follows uobject if it moves.
layer, effect3d are only interpreted by the 3D client
effect3d values can be found in client/particles dir.

Notes: effect = an item graphic number (the first in a series if an animation) speed = how fast the effect should travel. duration = controls the number of total frames to play in the animation (loops if greater than the length of the animation). 0 = play once. hue = which color should the effect have?
render values are:
0 no change
1 It becomes dark
2 It becomes bright
3 Bright color is emphasized and dark color is converted transparently
4 The translucency (transparency is high)
5 The translucency (it is close to primary color)
6 Negative positive reversal
7 The background which is transparent negative positive reversal
layer values are:
0 Head
1 RightHand
2 LeftHand
3 Waist
4 LeftFoot
5 RightFoot
7 CenterFeet

function.name: PlayStationaryEffectEx
function.prototype: PlayStationaryEffectEx( x, y, z, realm := _DEFAULT_REALM, effect, speed, duration := 0, hue := 0, render := 0, effect3d := 0 )

parameter.name: realm
parameter.value: String - case-sensitive name of the realm

function.explain: Starts a stationary graphic effect at x,y,z.
effect3d is only interpreted by the 3D client
effect3d values can be found in client/particles dir.

Notes: effect= is a UO graphic number (the first graphic in a series for an animated effect) speed = controls the time between frames of animation duration = controls the number of total frames to play in the animation (loops if greater than the length of the animation). 0 = play once.
render values are:
0 no change
1 It becomes dark
2 It becomes bright
3 Bright color is emphasized and dark color is converted transparently
4 The translucency (transparency is high)
5 The translucency (it is close to primary color)
6 Negative positive reversal
7 The background which is transparent negative positive reversal
layer values are:
0 Head
1 RightHand
2 LeftHand
3 Waist
4 LeftFoot
5 RightFoot
7 CenterFeet

function.explain: if ( type == CLOSE_CONTAINER ) object has to be a ContainerRef, to close the open container gump. else object has to be a MobRef to close paperdoll, status or profile of the chosen mob.
function.error: "Invalid object, has to be a containerRef"
"Invalid object, has to be a mobRef"

function.name: SendCharProfile
function.prototype: SendCharProfile( character, of_who, title, uneditable_text := CHARPROFILE_NO_UNEDITABLE_TEXT, editable_text := CHARPROFILE_NO_EDITABLE_TEXT )
function.explain: will send the serverside charprofile packet back to client and display it for the player.

function.name: SendOverallSeason
function.explain: Used to send the Season packet 0xBC to all clients logged on.
This function doesnt resend the lightlevel or weather after it sends season, that has to be done by scripts.

function.name: DistanceEuclidean
function.explain: Determines the distance between two objects. If either object is in a container, uses the world-position of its ultimate-parent container.
Notes: This distance is defined as sqrt(pow(object1.x-object2.x,2)+pow(object1.y-object2.y,2))

function.name: CoordinateDistanceEuclidean
function.explain: Calculates the distance between two coordinates.
Notes: This distance is defined as sqrt(pow(x1-x2,2)+pow(y1-y2,2))

function.name: GetMidpointCircleCoords

parameter.name: xcenter
parameter.value: Integer center of the circle coordinate

parameter.name: ycenter
parameter.value: Integer center of the circle coordinate

function.explain: based on given center coordinates and radius returns array of x,y structs which represent a circle
The array of coordinates is sorted, which means that its easily possible to only use every second point

function.name: SendPopUpMenu

parameter.name: to_whom
parameter.value: Character: who to send the menu to

parameter.name: above
parameter.value: Object: Item or Mobile to display the menu above

function.explain: Will show a pop-up context menu above the given object, waits for a reponse and return it (if no response is given, this could hang the script undefinitely)
Every element in the menu array must be an integer specifying a cliloc text for the menu or a struct { cliloc, [disabled,] [arrow,] [color] }
- cliloc: int, this is the only mandatory element in struct, the cliloc text id (min 3000000, max 3065535 if client version below 6)
- disabled: bool, if true, the menu entry will be disabled and shown in gray (default: false)
- arrow: bool, if true, an arrow will be shown (default: false)
- color: an optional rgb 1555 color (ex, 0 = transparent, 0x8000 = solid black, 0x1F = blue, 0x3E0 = green, 0x7C00 = red)
function.return: Error or Array index selected (0 if canceled). No validation is done.
function.error: "Menu elements must be int or struct"
